body: This error normally means, that the file is in use by another program and locked, so Syncthing cannot read it.
Specifically for a directory it could mean some program has it as it's current working directory, or an explorer window is open on it, or something.
I'd close this.
I have the same issue after upgrade to 0.12.4. Nothing blocks the folder (folders).

Are you sure you are not having the same issue with 0.12.3? 

How do you know if nothing is keeping the folders locked?
Also, what OS?

> Are you sure you are not having the same issue with 0.12.3?

I upgraded syncthing from 0.11.x to 0.12.4.

> How do you know if nothing is keeping the folders locked?

I cheked it.

> Also, what OS?

XP x32
Can you post the errors as well, just to make sure it's the same issue.

> Can you post the errors as well, just to make sure it's the same issue.

[SCMY2] 03:04:50 INFO: Puller (folder "Tantal", dir "3"): delete: remove \?\d:\Tantal\3: Процесс не может получить доступ к файлу, так как этот файл занят другим процессом.
[SCMY2] 03:04:51 INFO: Puller (folder "Tantal", dir "3"): delete: remove \?\d:\Tantal\3: Процесс не может получить доступ к файлу, так как этот файл занят другим процессом.
[SCMY2] 03:04:51 INFO: Folder "Tantal" isn't making progress. Pausing puller for 1m0s.
[SCMY2] 03:05:53 INFO: Puller (folder "Tantal", dir "3"): delete: remove \?\d:\Tantal\3: Процесс не может получить доступ к файлу, так как этот файл занят другим процессом.

I can delete folder in explorer. And on Windows 7 I don't have such issue.

Is it 100% reproducible?
What's the scenario to reproduce it?

> Is it 100% reproducible?

Yes. 
1) Create folder on Windows 7 machine.
2) After syncing delete folder on Windows 7 machine.
3) On WinXP machine the folder stay not deleted.
@calmh I'd say we drop support for Windows XP, as there is just trouble there, and I am not prepared to install a VM with a 15 year old OS just to debug it.

I don't think I want.

I guess we'll leave it for someone who runs WinXP and cares enough about it to debug it and fix it.
You can also see changes that went into v12 vs v11 and see if you can spot anything.

If this is XP specific it's probably not going to get fixed, but I'm fairly sure removing directories has worked fine on XP and probably still does. I'm inclined to suspect antivirus or similar, as that's often the cause for mysteriously locked files and directories. If removing directories on XP were broken in general I think we'd have more complaints...
Well there was some refactoring between v0.11 and v0.12 and I am just thinking that we might end up being in the same dir we are deleting for example.

> Well there was some refactoring between v0.11 and v0.12 and I am just thinking that we might end up being in the same dir we are deleting for example.

This is most likely.
We don't chdir anywhere. We stat files before deleting them, but that's basically the difference?
I just checked the issue on another WinXP machine. The result is the same.

So I guess we are not arguing that it does not happens.
The important bit is finding whats causing it. See if every version of v0.12 causes it to narrow it down. If it happens with v0.12.0, then someone who is interested in fixing this needs to do some git bisecting and seeing which commit breaks it, and fix it.
Thanks for advices, going to research it. The same issue: https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/issues/1308
